Message.Msg: It's so very uncharacteristic not to hear any tidbits leading-up to the CES show just 5 weeks away? Along with Tegra 4, I think Nvidia will start increasing the awareness of Geforce Grid and cloud gaming.
Don't know what CC's you;ve been listening to .. but Jen has been alluding to Tegra 4 in the upcoming CES when describing what's ahead.

Message.Title: NVDA is growing at 80%/year rate in Tablets and Smartphones
Message.Msg: In FYQ32010 NVidia did 63.4Million in revenue. In FYQ32013 Nvidia did 357.9Million in revenue. That is a about 290% growth over the three years or about 80%/year growth rates in Tablets and smart phones. During the same period the traditional PC business also grew but at single digits. Cash in the balance sheet keeps growing at a fast rate with cash now representing 40% of market value. This s why I think why Nvidia is a compelling takeover candidate or a candidate for leveraged buyout.

Topic.Title: nvidia's 2012 market share for smartphones? -- 00.90% -- Ha ha ha ha!

Message.Msg: So Best? When the pumper boys post that the tegra's growth rate is 80%, it's really quite meaningless, right? 80% growth on a teeny tiny 00.90% market share is still an Immaterial Rounding Error. Even a 550% growth rate would still be Immaterial. It appears that the pumper boys are pretending to ignore the fact that the tegra folly is an Absolute Commercial Failure.

Message.Title: "Windows RT was a bad mistake."
Message.Msg: The Windows 8 Sales Data Is In, And It's Bad News For Microsoft Nicholas Carlson | Nov. 30, 2012, 8:17 AM Remember when current CEO Jen was carnival barking about the new Windows 8 RT being THE best thing ever for nvidia? "Step right up, boys. And Behold the Win RT which will Transform our company." Looks like current CEO Jen was wrong. Again. "Windows RT was a bad mistake by MSFT." "Windows 8 tablet sales during that period were "almost nonexistent" "Asus CFO David Chang's comment that "demand for Windows 8 is not that good right now." "Microsoft cut its order of Surface tablets for the year to two million units, down from four million." Looks like Windows RT was a mistake for MSFT -- and a scratch for nvidia.

Hummm. Yahoo chopped the story part out. Here it is again. The Windows 8 Sales Data Is In, And It's Bad News For Microsoft Nicholas Carlson | Nov. 30, 2012, 8:17 AM NPD research published some bad news for Microsoft yesterday. Despite releasing an entirely new operating system on October 22 of this year, WindowsPC sales shrank 21 percent between 10/21 and 11/17 versus the same period last year. Windows 8 tablet sales during that period were "almost nonexistent" – just 1 percent of all Windows 8 sales. “It hasn’t made the market any worse, but it hasn’t stimulated things either,” Stephen Baker, an analyst at NPD, told The New York Times. “It hasn’t provided the impetus to sales everybody hoped for.” No kidding. Yesterday, we reported other bad news: Asus CFO David Chang's comment that "demand for Windows 8 is not that good right now." Microsoft cut its order of Surface tablets for the year to two million units, down from four million. This is a very scary time for Microsoft. Google it, boys : The Windows 8 Sales Data Is In, And It's Bad News For Microsoft Business Insider Remember when current CEO Jen was carnival barking about the new Windows 8 RT being THE best thing ever for nvidia? "Step right up, boys. And Behold the Win RT which will Transform our company." Looks like current CEO Jen was wrong. Again. "Windows RT was a bad mistake by MSFT." "Windows 8 tablet sales during that period were "almost nonexistent" "Asus CFO David Chang's comment that "demand for Windows 8 is not that good right now." "Microsoft cut its order of Surface tablets for the year to two million units, down from four million." Looks like Windows RT was a mistake for MSFT -- and a scratch for nvidia.

Message.Title: Watch for Asus November Monthly Revenue Numbers For Lead on 4Q Tegra 3 sales.
Message.Msg: Asus Tablet sales went from 910K in 2Q to 2351K in Q3. Forecasted 2600K in Q4. October (4 weeks) revenue came in 7% above Sept (5 weeks). Good lead on how well Nexus 7 and other Asus Tegra 3 tablets are doing in the market place.

Hummm. It appears that Yahoo's server doesn't like that news story. And chopped it out of my message. nvidia is no doubt somehow involved in the censorship. So be sure to check out that banned story yourself. Here is what you need to Google on : The Windows 8 Sales Data Is In, And It's Bad News For Microsoft

Thanks Best! For posting the title of that banned news story. I've read it, and here are a few of the highlights. "Windows RT was a bad mistake by MSFT." "Windows 8 tablet sales during that period were "almost nonexistent" "Asus CFO David Chang's comment that "demand for Windows 8 is not that good right now." "Microsoft cut its order of Surface tablets for the year to two million units, down from four million." You're right, Best. Windows RT -- what was supposed to be the latest messiah for struggling nvidia -- sounds like a scratch. Thanks again Best, for bringing us the banned news.

Message.Title: 'Demand For Windows 8 Is Not That Good Right Now,' Says Asus CFO
Message.Msg: 'Demand For Windows 8 Is Not That Good Right Now,' Says Asus CFO Jay Yarow | Nov. 28, 2012, 11:29 AM "More bad news for Microsoft's Windows 8. Asus CFO David Chang tells the Wall Street Journal, "Demand for Windows 8 is not that good right now." He said demand for touch notebooks has been slow. Asus is the fifth-biggest PC maker in the world, according to Gartner. In addition to Chang's quote, Nomura analyst Rick Sherlund writes today, "Windows 8 is off to an awkward launch." Forbeshas Sherlund's note, which says there's a "learning curve" for Windows 8, and PC makers have been slow to bring out Windows 8 computers. A quick note on Sherlund. He's one of the most respected Microsoft analysts—and that includes people at Microsoft. When he's saying something negative on the company, it's worth paying attention to. Sherlund is also warning that the iPad continues to eat into PC sales. Couple these reports with what we've previously heard -- that iMicrosoft sales are failing to meet internal expectations -- and there must be at least some concern at Microsoft's headquarters in Redmond, despite yesterday's report of 40 million licenses sold so far." "Microsoft sales are Failing to meet internal expectations." But things are okay with those tegra sales for Windows devices, right boys? Ha ha ha ha ha!

So there's something in that news article that "somebody" requested Yahoo to block. "I wonder how Yahoo's filter works", asked Best, curiously. Let's try an experiment, shall we? Maybe if we add a few characters here and there, it might screw-up the filter from well, filtering, right? And folks in this Great Freedom of Speech Country of Ours could read it. So let's add a few random $ here and there and see what happens. Here's yet another attempt to post that apparently blocked story. Well actually, it's about the 10th attempt, but who's counting. The Windows $8 Sales Data Is In, And It's Bad $ News For Micro$soft Nicholas Carl$son | Nov. 30, 2012, 8:$17 AM "NP$D research published some bad news for Micro$soft yesterday. Despite releasing an entirely new operating system on October 22 of this year, Windows PC sales $shrank 21 percent between 10/21 and 11/17 vers$us the same period last year. Windows 8 tablet sales during that period were "almost non$existent" – just 1 percent of all Windows 8 $sales. “It hasn’t made the market any worse, but it hasn’t stimulated things either,” Stephen Bak$er, an analyst at NP$D, told The New York $Times. “It hasn’t provided the impetus to sales everybody hoped for.” No kid$ding. Yesterday, we reported other bad news: Asu$s CFO Dav$id Cha$ng's comment that "demand for Windows 8 is not that good right now." Microsoft cut its order of Sur$face tablets for the year to two million units, down from four million. This is a very sca$ry time for Microsoft." Google it, boys : The Windows 8 Sales Data Is In, And It's Bad News For Microsoft Business Insider

Topic.Title: So Best? Who's the #7 Worst Stock in the 500 S&P?

Message.Msg: That raises an interesting question, right? It sure does. Should the current CEO of the #493rd Worst Performing Company out of 500 S&P peer-group companies receive a raise? Or continue to receive any free stock options? I think not. Just curious -- what do you paid nvda pumper boys think?

headline hawkers is all you guys are!!! yes, we manage companies from the headlines...yep, the media headlines....yep, yep, yep.....media is entertainment, not due diligence. You guys just spin your wheels.. Great move up over the last two weeks..made a tone of money...how bout you?

Message.Title: this board full of headline hawkers!!!
Message.Msg: headlines are marketing tools and are for entertainment purposes only...nobody should trust anything they read or see in the media...

Topic.Title: this board full of headline hawkers!!!

Message.Msg: I agree. ibbey should quit makin' up those sensationalized headlines about nvidia. To go with so-so stories remotely assocated with nvidia. 'Cause he can't find any good news to post about his employer.

Message.Title: So How Many Shares Is Nvidia Buying Back?
Message.Msg: 150M shares would leave them over $2B in cash! This includes the average cash flow of $200M per quarter plus the $300M from Intel on Jan 15th. Now that might shock anybody that is shorting this stock. Except Best...after all he called the dividend like he called the Rambus victory at the AT trial in SF last year. LOL JMHO

Topic.Title: Jeepers Best, Everybody else pays a dividend.

Message.Msg: "Those might be the 18 Most Powerful Words ever written on Yahoo. Which caused $47 million of shareholder's cash to be paid every quarter to the previously dividend-less shareholders of nvidia." $47 million per quarter x 4 = $188 million / 18 little words = $10.4 million per word. My my my. That little elf guy is much more Powerful than he looks. "Power To The Little People", right elf?

Topic.Title: Jeepers Best, Everybody else pays a dividend.

Message.Msg: "A community [like Yahoo for example] is democratic only when the humblest and weakest person can enjoy the highest civil, economic, and social rights that the biggest and most powerful possess. -- A. Philip Randolph, President of the National Brotherhood of Workers of America

Topic.Title: this board full of headline hawkers!!!

Message.Msg: best, you're a headline hawker as well

Message.Title: Think $20 - $27 by 2013 for NVDA
Message.Msg: In 2013 NVDA could see rapid PE expansion as the market comes to realize growth NVDA is making in Tablets and Smartphones. A solid 290% growth from ~250Million per year to ~1.4Billion in revenue in the growing tablet and smartphone market. Also I have heard that the Telcos are asking for second source to Qualcom. NVDA is a great second source. As NVDA hits about $1.50 in earnings next Fiscal year the PE will likely expand to 15 to 20 level taking the stock to the $20 - $30 range. Remember that the stock was at $27 just two years ago. Company has a massive buyback plan with the increasing cash and no debt. That is good.
